Posted By: True_Mumin (10/29/2009 7:21:55 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Yeah, the artwork is kind of odd....they made an attempt at forced-perspective to emphasize it's size, and it sort of half-worked. Also, it looks like a giant naked mole rat. Terrifying.
  
   
But this is actually nice. Nothing fancy, just a big cheap fattie. This is what green does. It's probably the only colour that could pull off a 6-mana 8/8 with two abilities. This can never become the norm, of course, but nice once in a blue moon.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: Noo! They finally did it. They made a creature with [Force of Nature](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Force of Nature)'s exact CMC and body with no drawback. The opposite, in fact. Posted By: Eggroll (10/8/2009 12:48:10 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I played a Zendikar tournament today. I had 2 life left and my opponent had 13. I played [Day of Judgment](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Day of Judgment) (Wrath of God except creatures can regenerate) Which killed my opponents 6 green token, 2 white flying token, 3 creatures, and my two flying 2/2s  
  
I played this card, [Terra Stomper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=186321), put a [Trusty Machete](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Trusty Machete) on him for a nice 10/9 creatures. Game Over. The game was pretty epic ended up drawing 1-1 with the guy.

Posted By: LeoKula (11/12/2009 10:35:55 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I think [Baloth Woodcrasher](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baloth Woodcrasher) is a better card in standard. You can build around the woodcrasher with crazy shenanigans like:  
[Khalni Heart Expedition](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Khalni Heart Expedition)  
Fetchland  
[Harrow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Harrow)  
Sac Khalni.  
That's 6 land drops, making a total of +24/+24. So you have a 28/28 Trampler. Then give him Vines.  
  
I still think this is an awesome card though, pulling him out in Limited really rocks.
posts.html:

I still think this is an awesome card though, pulling him out in Limited really rocks.
